00014 void runDivide_class::ReadRunRangeLimits(TString fileName){
00015   
00016   //no file provided for limits: no limits
00017   if(fileName.IsNull()){
00018     std::cout << "[WARNING] No run range limits file provided" << std::endl;
00019     return;
00020   }
00021 
00022   ifstream file(fileName);
00023   if(!file.good()){
00024     std::cerr << "[ERROR] File " << fileName << "to opened" << std::endl;
00025     return;
00026   }
00027 
00028   //filling the limits
00029   unsigned int limit_value;
00030   while(file.peek()!=EOF && file.good()){
00031     if(file.peek()==10){ 
00032       file.get(); 
00033       continue;
00034     }
00035 
00036     if(file.peek() == 35){
00037       file.ignore(1000,10);
00038       continue;
00039     }
00040 
00041     file>>limit_value;
00042 #ifdef DEBUG
00043     std::cout << "[DEBUG] " << limit_value << std::endl;
00044 #endif
00045 
00046     limits.insert(limit_value);
00047   }
00048 #ifdef DEBUG
00049   std::cout << "Run range limits:" << std::endl;
00050   for(std::set<unsigned int>::const_iterator limits_itr=limits.begin();
00051       limits_itr!=limits.end();
00052       limits_itr++){
00053     std::cout << *limits_itr << std::endl;
00054   }
00055 #endif
00056  
00057   return;
00058 }

00061 void runDivide_class::LoadRunEventNumbers(TTree *tree, TString runNumber_branchName, TString runTime_branchName){
00062   //void runDivide_class::LoadRunEventNumbers(TTree *tree, TString runNumber_branchName){
00063   Int_t runNumber;
00064   UInt_t runTime;
00065 
00066   tree->SetBranchStatus("*", 0);
00067   tree->SetBranchStatus(runNumber_branchName, 1);
00068   tree->SetBranchStatus(runTime_branchName, 1);
00069 
00070   tree->SetBranchAddress(runNumber_branchName, &runNumber);
00071   tree->SetBranchAddress(runTime_branchName, &runTime);
00072 
00073   //loop over tree and count the events per run
00074   tree->GetEntries();
00075   for(Long64_t ientry=0; ientry< tree->GetEntriesFast(); ientry++){
00076     //tree->LoadTree(ientry);
00077     tree->GetEntry(ientry);
00078 
00079     if((runNumber > 210000 || runNumber < 150000) && ientry < 3){
00080       tree->Show(ientry);
00081       std::cout << runNumber << "\t" << runTime << "\t" << runMinTimeRunMap[runNumber] << "\t" << runMaxTimeRunMap[runNumber] << std::endl;
00082     }
00083 
00084     if(eventsRunMap.count(runNumber)==0) eventsRunMap[runNumber]=1;
00085     else eventsRunMap[runNumber]+=1;
00086     if(runMinTimeRunMap.count(runNumber)==0) runMinTimeRunMap[runNumber]=runTime;
00087     else runMinTimeRunMap[runNumber] = std::min(runMinTimeRunMap[runNumber],runTime);
00088 
00089     if(runMaxTimeRunMap.count(runNumber)==0) runMaxTimeRunMap[runNumber]=runTime;
00090     else runMaxTimeRunMap[runNumber] = std::max(runMaxTimeRunMap[runNumber],runTime);
00091 
00092 #ifdef DEBUG
00093     if(ientry < 10) std::cout << runNumber << "\t" << runTime << "\t" << runMinTimeRunMap[runNumber] << "\t" << runMaxTimeRunMap[runNumber] << std::endl;
00094 #endif
00095   }
00096   tree->ResetBranchAddresses();
00097   return;
00098 }

00103 // loop over the map containing the number of events per run and divide the runs
00104 void runDivide_class::FillRunLimits(unsigned int nEvents_min){
00105   // initialize runLimits
00106   runLimits.clear();
00107 
00108 
00109 #ifdef DEBUG
00110   std::cout << "[DEBUG] eventsRunMap size: " << eventsRunMap.size() << std::endl;
00111   std::cout << "[DEBUG] nEvents_min: " << nEvents_min << std::endl;
00112 #endif
00113 
00114   Long64_t countEvents=0; //events in the run range
00115   unsigned int firstRun=(eventsRunMap.begin())->first; // start from the first run
00116 
00117   // initialize limits, first limit >= first run
00118   std::set<unsigned int>::const_iterator limit_itr = limits.begin(); //
00119   std::set<unsigned int>::const_iterator limitOld_itr=limit_itr;
00120   while(limit_itr != limits.end() && *limit_itr < firstRun) limit_itr++;
00121   
00122 #ifdef DEBUG
00123   std::cout << "[DEBUG] Starting loop" <<std::endl;
00124 #endif
00125   runLimits.insert(eventsRunMap.begin()->first); // add the first run by default
00126   for(std::map<unsigned int, Long64_t>::const_iterator run_itr = eventsRunMap.begin();
00127       run_itr!=eventsRunMap.end();
00128       run_itr++){
00129 
00130 #ifdef DEBUG
00131     std::cout << run_itr->first << "\t" << run_itr->second << "\t" << countEvents << "\t" << runLimits.size() << std::endl;
00132 #endif
00133 
00134 
00135     if(limit_itr != limits.end() && run_itr->first >= *limit_itr){ // reset the event counter to start a new run range
00136       //      std::cout << run_itr->first << " >= " << *limit_itr << "\t" << *(runLimits.rbegin()) << std::endl;
00137       // if you have few events you can merge this range with the previous,
00138       // but you should not pass one of the range limits: you can merge
00139       // run ranges within the same limits
00140       if(limit_itr!=limits.begin()) limitOld_itr=limit_itr; limitOld_itr--;
00141       if(countEvents<nEvents_min/2 && (*(runLimits.rbegin()) >*limitOld_itr && runLimits.size()!=1)){
00142         //      std::cout << *(--(runLimits.end())) << std::endl;
00143 #ifdef DEBUG
00144         std::cout << "Remove the last and aggregate: " << *(runLimits.rbegin()) << "\t" << *limitOld_itr << std::endl;
00145 #endif
00146         runLimits.erase(--(runLimits.end())); // remove the last and aggregate
00147         
00148       } //else std::cout << "[DEBUG] Runs from " << *(runLimits.rbegin()) << " have events: " << countEvents << " but reached run limit " << *limit_itr << std::endl;
00149       countEvents=0; //reset the counter
00150       runLimits.insert(run_itr->first);
00151 
00152       while(limit_itr != limits.end() && *limit_itr <= run_itr->first) limit_itr++; // update  the limit
00153 
00154     } else if (countEvents>nEvents_min){
00155       countEvents=0; //reset the counter
00156       runLimits.insert(run_itr->first);
00157     }
00158     countEvents+=run_itr->second; // add the events of this run
00159   }
00160 
00161   limitOld_itr=limit_itr; limitOld_itr--;
00162   //  std::cout << countEvents << "\t" << (*(runLimits.rbegin())) << "\t" << *limitOld_itr << std::endl;
00163 
00164   //#ifdef DEBUG
00165   //    std::cout << "Remove the last and aggregate: " << *(runLimits.rbegin()) << "\t" << *limitOld_itr << std::endl;
00166   //#endif
00167 
00168   if(countEvents<nEvents_min/2 && (*(runLimits.rbegin()) >*limitOld_itr )){
00169     //    std::cout << *(--(runLimits.end())) << std::endl;
00170     runLimits.erase(--(runLimits.end())); // remove the last and aggregate
00171   }
00172   // now the runLimits set has all the limits
00173       
00174   return;
00175 }

00181 std::vector<TString> runDivide_class::GetRunRanges(void){
00182   std::vector<TString> v;
00183 #ifdef DEBUG
00184   std::cout << "[DEBUG] runLimits size: " << runLimits.size() << std::endl;
00185 #endif
00186 
00187   
00188   for(std::set<unsigned int>::const_iterator runRange_itr = (runLimits.begin());
00189       runRange_itr!=runLimits.end();
00190       ){
00191     
00192     TString range;
00193     range+= *runRange_itr;
00194     range+="-";
00195     runRange_itr++;
00196     if(runRange_itr==runLimits.end()){
00197       range += eventsRunMap.rbegin()->first;
00198       //      runRange_itr--;
00199       //      range+=(*runRange_itr);
00200       //      runRange_itr++;
00201     } else range+=  ((*runRange_itr)-1);
00202 #ifdef DEBUG 
00203     std::cout << "[DEBUG] " << range << std::endl;
00204 #endif
00205     v.push_back(range);
00206 
00207   }
00208 
00209   return v;
00210 }

00212 std::vector<TString> runDivide_class::Divide(TTree *tree, TString fileName, 
00213                                              unsigned int nEvents_min, 
00214                                              TString runNumber_branchName){
00215 
00216 #ifdef DEBUG
00217   std::cout << "[DEBUG] Reading run range limits from file: " << fileName << std::endl;
00218 #endif 
00219   ReadRunRangeLimits(fileName);
00220 
00221 #ifdef DEBUG
00222   std::cout << "[DEBUG] Loading events per run from tree" << std::endl;
00223 #endif
00224   LoadRunEventNumbers(tree, runNumber_branchName);
00225   
00226 #ifdef DEBUG
00227   std::cout << "[DEBUG] Filling run limits" << std::endl;
00228 #endif
00229   FillRunLimits(nEvents_min);
00230 #ifdef DEBUG
00231   std::cout << "[DEBUG] Getting run ranges as string vector" << std::endl;
00232 #endif
00233   return GetRunRanges();
00234 
00235 }

00259 std::vector<std::pair<TString,Long64_t> > runDivide_class::GetRunRangeEvents(void){
00260   std::vector<std::pair<TString,Long64_t> > v;
00261 
00262 #ifdef DEBUG
00263   std::cout << "[DEBUG] runLimits size: " << runLimits.size() << std::endl;
00264 #endif
00265 
00266  
00267   for(std::set<unsigned int>::const_iterator runRange_itr = (runLimits.begin());
00268       runRange_itr!=runLimits.end();
00269       ){
00270     
00271     TString range;
00272     unsigned int runMin=*runRange_itr, runMax=0;
00273 
00274     runRange_itr++;
00275     if(runRange_itr==runLimits.end()){
00276       runMax = eventsRunMap.rbegin()->first;
00277     } else runMax =  ((*runRange_itr)-1);
00278     
00279     range+= runMin;
00280     range+="-";
00281     range+= runMax;
00282 
00283     Long64_t events=0;
00284     for(std::map<unsigned int, Long64_t>::const_iterator events_itr=eventsRunMap.lower_bound(runMin);
00285         events_itr!=eventsRunMap.upper_bound(runMax);
00286         events_itr++){
00287       #ifdef DEBUG
00288       std::cout << "[DEBUG] " << events_itr->first << "\t" << events << std::endl;
00289 #endif
00290       events+=events_itr->second;
00291     }
00292     
00293 #ifdef DEBUG 
00294     std::cout << "[DEBUG] " << range << "\t" << events << "\t" << runMin << "\t" << runMax << "\t"  << std::endl;
00295 #endif
00296     std::pair<TString, Long64_t> pair_tmp(range,events);
00297     v.push_back(pair_tmp);
00298 
00299   }
00300 
00301   return v;
00302 }

00304 void runDivide_class::PrintRunRangeEvents(void){
00305 
00306   std::vector<std::pair<TString,Long64_t> > v = GetRunRangeEvents();
00307   for(std::vector<std::pair<TString,Long64_t> >::const_iterator itr = v.begin();
00308       itr!=v.end();
00309       itr++){
00310     
00311     std::cout << itr->first << "\t" << itr->second << "\t" << GetRunRangeTime(itr->first) << std::endl;
00312   }
00313   return;
00314 }

00316 
00317 TString runDivide_class::GetRunRangeTime(TString runRange){
00318   TString runMin_ = runRange; runMin_.Remove(runRange.First('-'));
00319   TString runMax_ = runRange; runMax_.Remove(0,runRange.First('-')+1);
00320   TString runTimeRange;
00321   std::map<unsigned int,UInt_t>::const_iterator runMax_itr, runMin_itr;
00322   runMin_itr = runMinTimeRunMap.lower_bound(runMin_.Atoi());
00323   runMax_itr = runMaxTimeRunMap.upper_bound(runMax_.Atoi());  --runMax_itr;
00324   runTimeRange+=runMin_itr->second;
00325   runTimeRange+="-";
00326   runTimeRange+=runMax_itr->second;
00327   
00328   
00329   //std::cout <<  runMinTimeRunMap[runMin_.Atoi()] <<  "\t" << runMaxTimeRunMap[runMax_.Atoi()] << std::endl;
00330   
00331   return runTimeRange;
00332 }
